1000: You wish, %pcn, for power. With it you can thrash at shadows and have a hope. If I brought you this hope, what would you bring me? Would you destroy one who brings me pain?
1001: As I thought, no heart at all. We shall have no contract then, you and I, and, disappointed, return I to my cold palace. The souls within are no kinder than those here, but there, they follow.
1002: Would you? You would be my anesthesia? You will go to the lair of the _monster_ =monster_ at ___mondung_ and slay %g2? Ah, %pcf, for that I would give to you my _artifact_ which I have entrusted to my slave _qgfriend_. After =monster_ lies dead, go to ___qgfriend_ and meet my slave at __qgfriend_. You will recognize %g2 easily - a =qgfriend_. There you will receive the _artifact_. And now, I must return to my cold palace of Oblivion. I will await news.
1003: No. You must be looking for a different =qgfriend_. My name isn't _qgfriend_.
1004: So, you're %pcn, right? I'm _qgfriend_. I must say, I was wondering what kind of %ra it took to glide into a _monster_'s stronghold, murder the owner, and trip right on out. Very impressive. Nocturnal is likewise intrigued by you, hence this gift: _artifact_. Be careful with it, %pcf.
1005: =monster_ is a sneaky one -- %g brings the whole Mages Guild under suspicion.
I can't trust anyone at the Mages Guild, knowing =monster_ is a member.
Mages say =monster_ is hiding from Oblivion's wrath at ___fakedung_.
Mage's are gathering to scour ___fakedung_ for that scoundrel =monster_.
I saw a bunch of mages heading out to ___fakedung_.
I heard that traitor =monster_ is now hiding out in ___fakedung_.
1006: I knew =monster_ was in some kind of trouble, why else would %g leave so quickly?
The Mages Guild must have decided =monster_ was a liability to their image.
1007: Well, I can't say I'm surprised about =monster_; %g3 past caught up to %g2.
I don't even think the Archmagister is sad to hear of the death of =monster_.
1011: _qgfriend_ is one of the regulars at __qgfriend_, just %di of here.
_qgfriend_ is a =qgfriend_ who haunts __qgfriend_. That's to the %di.
1012: _qgfriend_ is an agent of Nocturnal, operating out of __qgfriend_ %di of here.
_qgfriend_ is one of the slaves of Nocturnal, Daedra Lady of the Night.
1013: Nocturnal is the mysterious Lady of the Night, one of the Daedric Regents.
Nocturnal is a Regent of Oblivion, whose sphere is darkness and mystery.
1015: Mages say =monster_ is hiding from Oblivion's wrath at ___fakedung_.
Mage's are gathering to scour ___fakedung_ for that scoundrel =monster_.
I saw a bunch of mages heading out to ___fakedung_.
I heard that traitor =monster_ is now hiding out in ___fakedung_.
1016: %oth!  =monster_, Oblivion's agent is upon us! I've moved the most valuable reagents to to ___fakedung_ and plan to meet you there after you've dealt with that pesky %ra.   N.
1017: A voice seems to echo in your ear: =monster_ ...sure...special place... news...
1018: %qdt: When I arrived at ___mondung_ an echo mentioned a 'special place' inside.
1019: %qdt: I found a note from =monster_ saying that %g is expected at ___fakedung_ after trying to bribe me.
1020: %qdt: I now have a contract with Nocturnal, one of the Daedric Princes of Oblivion. I have agreed to slay the _monster_ =monster_ in %g3 stronghold of ___mondung_ in exchange for Nocturnal's artifact, the _artifact_. I must have the deed done and meet her agent _qgfriend_ in __qgfriend_ of ___qgfriend_ in =1stparton_ days or I will have failed the contract. This may mean something worse than just me not getting the _artifact_.
1021: %qdt: =monster_ offered me _bow_ in exchange for %g3 life, and I could not resist. %g said that it is somewhere in ___bowdung_.  Since I have already betrayed Nocturnal, I may as well try to find it.
1022: %qdt: =monster_ offered me the _ring_ in exchange for %g3 life, and I could not resist. %g said that it is somewhere in ___ringdung_.  Since I have already betrayed Nocturnal, I may as well try to find it.
1023: %qdt: =monster_ offered me the _staff_ in exchange for %g3 life, and I could not resist. %g said that it is somewhere in _staffdung_.  Since I have already betrayed Nocturnal, I may as well try to find it.
1030: Wait!  I know that Nocturnal has sent you, and that she has promised you the _artifact_.  But if it is truly power you seek, I can top her offer -- if you cease your attack, I will tell you where to find _bow_. Do you agree to my offer?
1031: Wait!  I know that Nocturnal has sent you, and that she has promised you the _artifact_.  But if it is truly power you seek, I can top her offer -- if you cease your attack, I will tell you where to find the _ring_. Do you agree to my offer?
1032: Wait!  I know that Nocturnal has sent you, and that she has promised you the _artifact_.  But if it is truly power you seek, I can top her offer -- if you cease your attack, I will tell you where to find the _staff_. Do you agree to my offer?
1035: You have slain =monster_. Prince Nocturnal will now rest easier.
1040: Excellent.  I knew you had a mercenary's heart.  _bow_ lies hidden in ___bowdung_. You have only to find it and you will be a power to be reckoned with indeed.  Now, I bid you good day, lest you decide to claim both _bow_ and the _artifact_ by killing me.  A mercenary heart such as yours should not be trusted too far!
1041: Excellent.  I knew you had a mercenary's heart.  The _ring_ lies hidden in ___ringdung_. You have only to find it and you will be a power to be reckoned with indeed.  Now, I bid you good day, lest you decide to claim both the _ring_ and the _artifact_ by killing me.  A mercenary heart such as yours should not be trusted too far!
1042: Excellent.  I knew you had a mercenary's heart.  The _staff_ lies hidden in _staffdung_. You have only to find it and you will be a power to be reckoned with indeed.  Now, I bid you good day, lest you decide to claim both the _staff_ and the _artifact_ by killing me.  A mercenary heart such as yours should not be trusted too far!
1045: Mocking laughter echoes in your mind,   "You should have known better than to trust me, %pcn.  Perhaps this shadow of power can satisfy your craving for a time, while you rage vainly against those who actually possess it.  Me for example. I do hope sweet Nocturnal won't be too displeased with your treachery."   _bow_ crumbles to dust in your hand.
1046: Mocking laughter echoes in your mind,   "You should have known better than to trust me, %pcn.  Perhaps this shadow of power can satisfy your craving for a time, while you rage vainly against those who actually possess it.  Me for example. I do hope sweet Nocturnal won't be too displeased with your treachery."   The _ring_ crumbles to dust in your hand.
1047: Mocking laughter echoes in your mind,   "You should have known better than to trust me, %pcn.  Perhaps this shadow of power can satisfy your craving for a time, while you rage vainly against those who actually possess it.  Me for example. I do hope sweet Nocturnal won't be too displeased with your treachery."   The _staff_ crumbles to dust in your hand.
1050: Nocturnal was most impressed at your daring, %pcn.  She asked me to kill you quickly as a reward for such audacious treachery.
